snippet: Representative Paul D. Ryan detoured from the campaign trail to vote on a measure that will avoid a government default and an election-season battle.
abstract: Rep Paul D Ryan returns to the House to vote on stopgap spending measure, which easily passes, 329 to 91, following Ryan's approval; smooth passage of the bill is a marked departure from the budget fights that threatened to shut down the government in 2011, with the approaching election and the political threat of another debilitating showdown overwhelming Republican instincts for a fight.
lead_paragraph: Representative Paul D. Ryan detoured from the campaign trail to vote on a measure that will avoid a government default and an election-season battle.

headline.main: House Republicans Welcome Back Ryan, and His Vote, on a Spending Measure
headline.print_headline: House Republicans Welcome Back Ryan, and His Vote, on a Spending Measure
